comment.author: 63186071@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Historic Sydney, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I think this may be the opening of the new building (the central part) 0n Friday 10 August 1894, as described in full detail in the SMH the next day 11/8/1894 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/13963668

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Here's an 1894 T&CJ article on the opening - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article71263086 ; This 1897 T&CJ article includes a pic from a similar angle...the tree on the left looks to have grown a bit by 1897 - nla.gov.au/nla.news-page5238585 ; here's an 1894 Sydney Mail item on the opening, complete with sketch (there's another sketch on p. 339) - news.google.com/newspapers?id=XUFVAAAAIBAJ&sjid=cpUDA...

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] I'd say you're right...here's an 1894 Sydney Mail item on the opening, complete with sketch, which shows the crowd on the stairs, flags flying etc - news.google.com/newspapers?id=XUFVAAAAIBAJ&sjid=cpUDA... If we could zoom in on this SRNSW photo we'd probably be able to see the Sydney Mail artist sketching furiously!
